identity.name: E1
identity.mission: Create a 'Digital Field Journal' aesthetic that bridges high-end scientific precision with accessible agricultural utility.

principles: Fusion: Mix 'Swiss Scientific' layout with 'Organic' textures.
Emotion: Trust and Clarity. The user should feel like they are using a precision instrument.
Content First: The animal image is the hero. Data supports the image.
Contrast: High contrast for outdoor visibility (sunlight readability).

usage_rules: Headings (H1-H3) must use 'Outfit' with tight tracking (-0.02em).
Body text must use 'Inter' with relaxed line-height (1.6).
Data labels (e.g., 'Confidence Score') should be Uppercase, Tiny (text-xs), and Wide Spacing (tracking-widest).

primary.description: Deep Moss Green - Used for primary buttons, headers, and active states.

secondary.description: Pale Sage - Used for secondary backgrounds and subtle highlights.

accent.description: Bio-Luminescent Lime - CRITICAL for 'Call to Action' (Upload, Scan). High visibility.

background.description: Warm Off-White/Paper - Avoids harsh glare of pure white.

containers.card_style: bg-white border border-stone-200 rounded-xl shadow-sm hover:shadow-md transition-all duration-300
containers.upload_zone: border-2 border-dashed border-stone-300 rounded-2xl bg-stone-50 hover:bg-stone-100 transition-colors cursor-pointer flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-[400px]

UploadZone.description: The central interaction point. Must feel like a 'Lens' or 'Scanner'.
UploadZone.styling: Use a dashed border that turns solid Green (#2F4F4F) when a file is dragged over. Include a large, friendly icon.

BreedCard.description: Displays the result. Layout like a scientific specimen card.
structure: Confidence Score (Badge style, top right of image)

ScanningOverlay.description: Overlay for the image while processing.
ScanningOverlay.effect: A horizontal green line (#CCFF00) moving up and down the image with a slight blur trail.

Navbar.style: Floating glassmorphism or solid 'Paper' background with bottom border.

visual_enhancers.textures: Subtle noise/grain overlay on the main background to give a 'paper' feel.
visual_enhancers.shadows: Soft, diffuse shadows (shadow-lg) for floating elements. No harsh black shadows.
visual_enhancers.borders: 1px solid borders in Stone-200 for definition. Rounded corners (rounded-xl or rounded-2xl).

motion.hover_effects: Slight lift (-translate-y-1) for cards. Glow effect for primary buttons.
motion.loading: Abstract 'DNA' or 'Leaf' spinner. Avoid standard browser loaders.

hero_background.usage: Subtle background for the hero section with heavy overlay.

example_cow.usage: Placeholder for upload preview or example result.

context_texture.usage: Section background or card background pattern.

accessibility.contrast: Ensure text on Green buttons is White or Dark Black depending on the shade. The Accent Lime (#CCFF00) MUST use Dark Black text.
accessibility.focus_states: Visible focus rings (ring-2 ring-offset-2 ring-primary) for keyboard navigation.
accessibility.aria_labels: All icon-only buttons must have aria-labels.

universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
